metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15422 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in international date handling in International Components for Unicode (ICU) for C/C++ before 60.1, as used in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 63.0.3239.84 and other products, allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory read via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15422` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libicu60 - 60.2-3ubuntu3
libiculx60 - 60.2-3ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> same as wheezy, precise/esm is not affected code is not present.

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1').
icu package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '60.2-3ubuntu3').
